intro: Begonia bogneri, commonly known as the Bogner's begonia, is a species native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It is a herbaceous perennial plant characterized by its striking, velvety leaves and clusters of showy, tubular flowers. The leaves are typically heart-shaped and often have a waxy texture, while the flowers range in color from red to orange. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
